pattern_sources.name: cocoknits
pattern_sources.author: Julie Weisenberg
pattern_sources.notes: My aim in creating my website is to reach creative knitters who want a finished product that says something unique about their personality. Each pattern is meant not as a rigid template but as a guide, a jumping-off point from which you can determine your own style through choice of texture, color, shape, and embellishments. I hope that you will find cocoknits an inspiration as well as a resource.

pattern_sources.name: The Simple Collection
pattern_sources.author: Tin Can Knits
pattern_sources.notes:
**The Simple Collection ::: learn to knit with Alexa and Emily**

This year at Tin Can Knits we explore the basic ingredients of knitting.  The Simple Collection has quick accessories and simple sweaters, sized from newborn to grandpa, in worsted weight yarn and best of all **‚Äì the patterns are all free for you to use and share with your friends!**

With 8 new free patterns (including 2 sweaters!) and clear tutorials, the collection is perfect for newer knitters building skills and confidence; and also a treat for knitters who enjoy modern lines and simple details. Whether you are knitting your first scarf, cozy socks for your dad, or a sweater for your little man, the Simple Collection will teach you all you need to know to make modern seamless knits for the whole family!

The designs and tutorials will be released a few at a time over the next 6 months, so be sure to get our email updates and we will let you know when they are available!

pattern_sources.name: Tin Can Knits
pattern_sources.author: Emily Wessel & Alexa Ludeman
pattern_sources.notes:
**We love to knit, and we created Tin Can Knits to share the love!** 

If you like our designs, [get our email updates][1] - that way you won't miss out on our [new designs][2], [in-depth tutorials][3], and subscriber-only special offers!

‚ô• Emily Wessel and Alexa Ludeman ‚ô•

  [1]: http://eepurl.com/k5p8L
  [2]: http://www.tincanknits.com/patterns.html
  [3]: http://www.tincanknits.com/techniques.html

pattern_sources.name: zig-zag e-book
pattern_sources.author: Georgie Hallam
pattern_sources.notes:
The zig-zag e-book features five super fun to knit little kiddies patterns.  
All the patterns share the same easy to work zig-zag stitch. 
All patterns are seamless and eye-catching yet super simple designs with a few fun little techniques thrown into the mix.

The first pattern to be release, [ziggy](pattern) is a jumper with either a hood or a collar, worked in the perfect yarn weight for children; dk.

The second pattern is the ziggy beanie, sized from premmie to adult sized.

A [skirt][1], vest with a [modern][2] or [traditional][3] neckline and [leg warmer][4] patterns  round out the ebook.



Look out for the adult patterns coming soon!


  [1]: http://www.ravelry.com/projects/tikki/ziggidy-doo
  [2]: http://www.ravelry.com/projects/tikki/zigvest
  [3]: http://www.ravelry.com/projects/tikki/zigvest-2
  [4]: http://www.ravelry.com/projects/tikki/zeg-warmers

pattern_sources.name: Two Little Plums
pattern_sources.author: Alicia Plummer
pattern_sources.notes:
My username is [AliciaPlum][1].

Designing for me is like writing a novel expressing everything I‚Äôm feeling and doing and thinking. Color, lines, fit, can tell a story, and I love seeing how others interpret and knit up my stories.

I‚Äôm messy, disorganized, and loving. I design because I wear my heart on my sleeve, and designing is a perfect outlet for self-expression. I‚Äôm heavily influenced by the rustic beauty of our old farmhouse and my small town here in rural Maine.

My aim is to design things that have the down home comfort of New England but are also everyday items that someone can grab and throw on and still look good.

I have a wonderful group with my dear friend and design partner, Melissa called [Plum Dandi][2]. We do giveaways, knit alongs, test calls, and fun threads all the time and I must say we have some of the nicest Ravelers around!


  [1]: http://www.ravelry.com/people/AliciaPlum
  [2]: http://www.ravelry.com/groups/plum-dandi
